src:
Racman odkupil lastno vilo?
Izklicna cena na dražbi je bila 851.525 evrov, končna skoraj podvojena. Najvišji znesek ponudil R.E. Invest, katerega direktor je bil nekoč Urban Racman.
01 Nov 2019, 06:45 by Aleksandar Lukić



Sergeja Racmana smo na Okrožnem sodišču v Ljubljani ujeli 30. maja letos. Zdaj se obravnav ne udeležuje več. FOTO: Aleksandar Lukić



Racmana, ki ima prebivališče prijavljeno v Bratislavi, išče tudi Interpol z rdečo tiralico.



Hiša se skriva za visokim zidom. FOTO: Igor Mali



Vilo je na koncu kupilo podjetje R.E. Invest za 1,570.000 evrov. Na sodišču jih je predstavljal odvetnik Mirko Filipović, ki se je na koncu športno rokoval z nasprotnico na dražbi, zastopnico DUTB, Cvetko Smrekar. FOTO: Marko Feist


LJUBLJANA – Vsega 22 minut in 1,57 milijona evrov je bilo včeraj potrebnih, da je novega lastnika dobila več kot 600 kvadratnih metrov (bruto površine) velika vila na ljubljanski Galjevici, s parkovno urejenim travnikom, zunanjim bazenom in samostojno garažo za več vozil. Nepremičnino, ki jo obdaja visoka ograja in je tako varna pred pogledi radovednežev, so (posredno) zarubili razvpitemu podjetniku Sergeju Racmanu. Ta je javnosti verjetno najbolj znan po Kolosej kinematografih, v zadnjih mesecih pa medije polni zaradi poslov, povezanih z domnevno prostitucijo. Prav zaradi slednjega je njegova fotografija pristala na policijskem seznamu iskanih oseb, za njim je izdana tudi Interpolova rdeča tiralica.
71ponudb so oddali dražitelji.
Sedem dražiteljev


Racmana, ki ima prebivališče prijavljeno v Bratislavi, išče tudi Interpol z rdečo tiralico.

V sobi številka 6 Okrajnega sodišča v Ljubljani se je za vilo zaradi dolgov družbe Auctor, katere stoodstotni lastnik je Racman, v postopku javne dražbe spopadlo sedem dražiteljev. Ti so si vstopnico za sodelovanje kupili z vplačilom vsak po nekaj več kot 85.000 evrov varščine, boja zanjo pa Racman, ki po zadnjih javno dostopnih podatkih živi v Bratislavi, ni spremljal v živo.Dražba je bila sklicana ob 9.30. V manjšo sodno dvorano, v kateri ni bilo dovolj sedišč za vse, se je stisnilo 21 ljudi. Sodnica Tatjana Kukanja je med vsemi prisotnimi, tako zainteresirane javnosti kot dražiteljev, pobrala podatke in že povesem na začetku pojasnila, da bo najprej potekalo fotografiranje. Tistim, ki niso želeli biti na fotografijah, je dala možnost, da sodno sobo zapustijo, po terminu za fotografiranje pa so se lahko vrnili. Ponujeno so izkoristili skoraj vsi, le par pogumnežev je nastavilo svoj obraz objektivom, med drugimi edina fizična oseba, ki je sodelovala na dražbi, športni psiholog Matej Tušak. Po vrnitvi v sodno dvorano in nekaj besedah sodnice se je okoli 10. ure začelo zares.
Z našim denarjem kupujejo, je bilo slišati iz publike, ko je ceno višala državna DUTB.
Višali po 10 tisočakov
Dražbo je s prvo ponudbo odprlo podjetje Boter R, nato pa se pri višanju zneska, vedno v koraku za najmanj 10.000 evrov (predlog enega od sodelujočih, da bi bil korak 5000 evrov, so kolegi dražitelji gladko zavrnili, češ, da bo dražba trajala predolgo), ni več pridružil. Iz minute v minuto je bilo bolj vroče, znesek za ogromno vilo z bazenom pa se je nenehno dvigal. Kaj hitro se je izkazalo, da bo glavna bitka za prestižno posestvo Ob dolenjski železnici z bazenom, samostojno garažo za več vozil v dveh nadstropjih in steklenjakom, potekala med tremi ponudniki. To so bili državna DUTB (med draženjem je bilo iz publike slišati, citiramo: »Z našim denarjem kupujejo!«), v postopku sicer tudi upnik (od Auctorja terjajo 2,3 milijona evrov), ter podjetji, ki sta, zanimivo, na istem naslovu, Bovin in R.E. Invest (varščino sta poleg omenjenih vplačali še podjetji Trezor in RRC računalniške storitve). V imenu R.E. Investa je ponudbe dajal odvetnik Mirko Filipović, prav njemu pa je DUTB oziroma njena predstavnica Cvetka Smrekar na koncu popustila in po 28 podanih ponudbah (vseh skupaj so dražitelji podali 71) prepustila nepremičnino za ceno, ki pa še vedno ne bo pokrila dolga, ki ga ima Auctor do DUTB.
Na začetku dražbe je sodnica dražitelje seznanila, da jih je dolžnik obvestil o zasedenosti nepremičnine z najemnikom in da je to že bilo sporočeno vsem oglednikom. Sodnica Tatjana Kukanja je dejala, da to ni ovira za prodajo. Novo dejstvo je zmotilo le enega dražitelja, ki ga je zanimalo, ali gre za pogodbo za določen ali nedoločen čas. Sodnica s tem podatkom ni razpolagala, drugi pa pripomb na to niso imeli in jih to očitno ni motilo. Maja 2016, tako je razvidno iz javno dostopnega cenilnega poročila, je bila nepremičnina nezasedena. Sodna izvedenka in cenilka Eva Medved je takrat zapisala: »Ob ogledu stavba ne daje videza vseljenosti, predvidevam, da dela še niso zaključena (del kratkotrajnih elementov) ali v stavbi potekajo dela preureditev.«


Vilo je na koncu kupilo podjetje R.E. Invest za 1,570.000 evrov. Na sodišču jih je predstavljal odvetnik Mirko Filipović, ki se je na koncu športno rokoval z nasprotnico na dražbi, zastopnico DUTB, Cvetko Smrekar. FOTO: Marko Feist

Kmalu po dražbi so nekateri mediji pisali, da bi utegnil za tem podjetjem stati Racman. Iz javnih evidenc je razvidno, da je zdajšnji direktor Hrvat Tomislav Rukavina, stoodstotni lastnik slovenske družbe pa je zagrebško podjetje Alea automat klub. Pred Rukavino, tako kažejo javne evidence, je bil direktor Urban Racman – javnosti je znano, da ima Sergej Racman bratranca s takšnim imenom in priimkom. Je to le naključje? Odgovor, ali je bila nepremičnina kupljena za Sergeja Racmana, smo želeli dobiti pri odvetniku Filipoviću, a ta zadeve ni želel komentirati. Več smo želeli izvedeti neposredno v družbi R.E. Invest, kjer pa je signal ob vsakem našem klicu nakazoval, da je linija zasedena. 


Hiša se skriva za visokim zidom. FOTO: Igor Mali
text:
Racman bought his own villa?
The starting price of the auction was EUR 851,525, the final price almost doubling. The maximum amount offered by R.E. Invest, whose director was once Urban Racman.
01 Nov 2019, 06:45 by Aleksandar Lukic



We caught Sergei Racman at the Ljubljana District Court on May 30 this year. Now he no longer attends the hearing. PHOTO: Aleksandar Lukic



Racman, who is domiciled in Bratislava, is also seeking Interpol with a red tyrant.



The house is hiding behind a high wall. PHOTO: Igor Mali



The villa was eventually purchased by R.E. Invest for € 1,570,000. In court, they were represented by lawyer Mirko Filipovic, who eventually shook hands with his opponent at the auction, BAMC's representative, Cvetko Smrekar. PHOTO: Marko Feist


LJUBLJANA - It took only 22 minutes and 1.57 million euros yesterday to get a new owner over 600 square meters (gross floor space) of a large villa in Ljubljana's Galjevica, with a park landscaped lawn, an outdoor swimming pool and a detached garage for several vehicles. The property, surrounded by a high fence, which is so safe from the eyes of the curious, was (indirectly) seized by notorious businessman Sergei Racman. This is probably best known to the public for the Coliseum of Cinemas, and in recent months it has been filling the media for deals related to alleged prostitution. Because of the latter, his photograph landed on the police wanted list, followed by the Interpol Red Arrow.
71 bids have been submitted by bidders.
Seven bidders


Racman, who is domiciled in Bratislava, is also seeking Interpol with a red tyrant.

In room 6 of the Ljubljana District Court, seven bidders were confronted in the auction process for the villa owing to the debts of Auctor, wholly owned by Racman. They bought the ticket for the participation with a payment of just over € 85,000 each, and the fight for it was not followed live by Racman, who lives in Bratislava, according to the latest publicly available information. The auction was called at 9.30am. The small courtroom, which lacked enough seating for everyone, crammed 21 people. Judge Tatjana Kukanja collected information from all those present, both interested public and auctioneers, and explained at the outset that the first photographing would take place. It gave those who did not want to be in the photos the opportunity to leave the courtroom, but after the appointment was taken, they were able to return. It was used by almost everyone, with only a couple of courageous people setting their faces on the lenses, including the only natural person who participated in the auction, sports psychologist Matej Tušak. After returning to the courtroom and a few words from the judge, it started really around 10am.
With our money buying, it was heard from the audience when the price was raised by the state BAMC.
Increased 10 thousand each
The first bid was opened by Boter R and then raised by at least 10,000 euros (increasing the amount by at least 10,000 euros) (one of the bidders suggested that the step be 5,000 euros), which was smoothly rejected by fellow auctioneers, saying that the auction would take too long ), no longer joined. It was getting hotter by the minute, and the amount for a huge villa with a pool was constantly rising. What quickly turned out to be the main battle for the prestigious estate At the Dolenjska Railway with a swimming pool, a detached multi-storey garage on two floors and a greenhouse, will take place between three bidders. These were the state BAMC (during the teasing it was heard from the audience, we quote, "With our money they buy!"), In the process, also the creditor (they demand € 2.3 million from Auctor), and the companies, which, interestingly, same title, Bovin and RE Invest (in addition to the aforementioned, the security was paid by Trezor and RRC computer services). On behalf of R.E. Investor was bidding on the lawyer Mirko Filipovic, and it was BAMC or its representative Cvetka Smrekar who eventually relented and after 28 bids (71 bidders in total) left the property for a price, which still will not cover the debt, which has Auctor do BAMC.
At the beginning of the auction, the judge informed the auctioneers that the debtor had informed them of the occupancy of the property with the tenant and that this had already been communicated to all viewers. Judge Tatjana Kukanja said this was not a barrier to sales. The new fact annoyed only one bidder who was interested in whether it was a fixed or an indefinite contract. The judge did not have this information, but others did not comment on it and obviously did not mind. In May 2016, as shown in the publicly available valuation report, the property was vacant. Court expert and appraiser Eva Medved wrote at the time: "When viewed, the building does not give the appearance of occupancy, I assume that the works are not yet completed (part of the short-term elements) or that some renovations are underway in the building."


The villa was eventually purchased by R.E. Invest for € 1,570,000. In court, they were represented by lawyer Mirko Filipovic, who eventually shook hands with his opponent at the auction, BAMC's representative, Cvetko Smrekar. PHOTO: Marko Feist

Shortly after the auction, some media reported that Racman might be behind the company. Public records show that the current director is Croat Tomislav Rukavina, while the 100% owner of the Slovenian company is Alea automat klub, a Zagreb-based company. Before Rukavina, according to public records, was the director of Urban Racman - it is known to the public that Sergei Racman has a cousin with that name. Is this just a coincidence? We wanted to get an answer if the property was purchased for Sergei Racman from lawyer Filipovic, but he did not want to comment on this matter. We wanted to find out more directly at R.E. Invest, however, where every signal on our call indicated that the line was busy.


The house is hiding behind a high wall. PHOTO: Igor Mali
